nodes.name: Fragmented AI safety collaboration reduces progress
aliases: lack of coordination in AI safety
nodes.description: Dispersed researchers and enthusiasts fail to coordinate, slowing development and deployment of safety methods.
nodes.node_rationale: Implied overarching problem in opening paragraph about need for communities.

nodes.name: Lack of centralized information on AI safety communities
aliases: missing directory of AI safety groups
nodes.description: Individuals interested in AI safety have no single place to discover relevant local or online groups, hindering networking.
nodes.node_rationale: Explicitly stated as motivation: AED team 'identified having a living document listing them all as a low-hanging fruit'.

nodes.name: Centralized community listing enhances researcher connectivity
nodes.description: Providing a single, easily discoverable directory is expected to help people find and join suitable AI safety groups.
nodes.node_rationale: Implicit reasoning: live database will solve the information gap.

nodes.name: Living document updated by volunteers encourages comprehensive coverage
nodes.description: Keeping the list editable and actively maintained ensures it remains current and broad, maximizing usefulness.
nodes.node_rationale: Post encourages readers to 'add communities', 'improve descriptions', and 'volunteer as a maintainer'.

nodes.name: Crowd-sourced online database on coda.io listing AI safety communities
nodes.description: Public spreadsheet hosted on coda.io, containing names, locations, contact links, and descriptions of AI safety groups.

nodes.name: Early adoption metrics of AI safety community database
nodes.description: Presence of many entries and active volunteer maintenance signal that the approach is gaining traction.
nodes.node_rationale: Inferred from statements about 'rapidly growing field' and existing volunteers maintaining the list.

nodes.name: Maintain and update live AI safety community database

nodes.intervention_lifecycle_rationale: Actionable post-deployment activity; section 'Here’s what you can do now:'
nodes.intervention_maturity_rationale: Database is already operational and in active use.

nodes.name: Promote joining and contributing to AI safety communities via shared database links
nodes.description: Encourage researchers and the public to access the database and join suitable groups, e.g., by linking friends.
nodes.intervention_lifecycle_rationale: Deployment-phase outreach; from action items #1 and #2.
nodes.intervention_maturity_rationale: Mostly informal outreach; limited systematic validation.
nodes.node_rationale: Directly suggested under 'Here’s what you can do now:' items 1 & 2.

nodes.name: Recruit volunteer maintainers through AED Discord and monthly calls
nodes.description: Advertise maintainer opportunities in Alignment Ecosystem Development Discord and monthly pitch calls.
nodes.intervention_lifecycle_rationale: Deployment-phase human resource action; referenced in paragraph about joining AED Discord and monthly calls.
nodes.intervention_maturity_rationale: Ongoing recruitment, limited systematic study of effectiveness.
nodes.node_rationale: Explicit invitation near the end of the post.
